intro: Hieracium lanceolatifolium, commonly known as the lanceolate hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and produces numerous small florets arranged in a composite head. It is often found in open habitats and is considered a perennial herb.
